smart-widget/padding.description: set `widget-body__content` padding style, type: number | number[], default: [12, 20]

smart-widget/simple.description: whether show widget header, default: false

smart-widget/shadow.description: when to show card shadows, default: 'always'

smart-widget/translateY.description: when to show card shadows, default: 0

smart-widget/headerHeight.description: widget header height, the value should be a natural number. default: 48

smart-widget-grid/layout.description: This is the initial layout of the grid. Required. The value must be an Array of Object items. Each item must have i, x, y, w and h properties.

smart-widget-grid/responsiveLayouts.description: Says how many columns the grid has. The value should be a natural number. Default: {}

smart-widget-grid/colNum.description: This is the initial layouts of the grid per breakpoint if responsive is set to true. Default: 12

smart-widget-grid/rowHeight.description: Says what is a height of a single row in pixels. Default: 48

smart-widget-grid/maxRows.description: Says what is a maximal number of rows in the grid. Default: Infinity

smart-widget-grid/margin.description: Says what are the margins of elements inside the grid. The value must be a two-element Array of Number. Each value is expressed in pixels. The first element is a margin horizontally, the second element is a vertical margin.

smart-widget-grid/draggable.description: Says if the grids items are draggable. Default: true

smart-widget-grid/resizable.description: Says if the grids items are resizable. Default: true

smart-widget-grid/isMirrored.description: Says if the RTL/LTR should be reversed. Default: false

smart-widget-grid/autoSize.description: Says if the container height should swells and contracts to fit contents. Default: true

smart-widget-grid/verticalCompact.description: Says if the layout should be compact vertically. Default: true

smart-widget-grid/preventCollision.description: Says if grid items will move when being dragged over. Default: false

smart-widget-grid/useCssTransforms.description: Says if the CSS transition-property: transform; should be used. Default: false

smart-widget-grid/responsive.description: Says if the layout should be responsive to window width. Default: false

smart-widget-grid/breakpoints.description: Breakpoints defined for responsive layout. Sets widths on wich column number changes. Default: { lg: 1200, md: 996, sm: 768, xs: 480, xxs: 0 }

smart-widget-grid/cols.description: Defines number of columns for each breakpoint. Default: { lg: 12, md: 10, sm: 6, xs: 4, xxs: 2 }

smart-widget-grid/useStyleCursor.description: Says if set the styleCursor option to true. When dragging freezes, setting this value to false may alleviate problems. This property is not reactive. Default: true

smart-widget-grid/isStatic.description: Says if all grid item is static (won't be draggable, resizable or moved by other items), Default: false
